table.name: d100 Character Traits
table.caption: Character Traits
rows: A hurried and stressed person, they end their sentences in a slightly higher pitch or a questioning tone.
Easily distracted by mundane things but they always have a cheerful attitude.
An arrogant coward with a royal background, They flaunt their wealth a lot.
Twitchy and nervous. they are easily scared or jolted by mundane things.
A grumpy and discontent individual they always seems to be holding in their anger.
A charming person that always has a compliment for a friend.
Fearless but not very bright, tends to settle arguments with their fists.
Cunning and sly, easily offended when it comes to their wealth.
Cheerful and hyperactive. They almost always have a smile on their face.
Silent and thoughtful. Speaks slowly and uses a minimal amount of words.
Mischievous but with a heart of gold. Would never hurt anyone. Teases people a lot.
Loud and unapologetic. Often makes rude comments and farts a lot. Usually laughs it off.
Often sad, they try to see the good things in bad situations but have a hard time doing so.
A stoic individual, they always rationalize their feelings. They can see most things objectively.
Satisfied and settled down, they are comfortable and happy where they are right now.
Impatient, they are easily irritated by ignorant or slow people. They often tell people to hurry up.
Traumatized by events they experienced, they will stop at nothing to get revenge.
An expressive individual, they talk with their hands and hug others as a form of greeting.
Often under the influence of narcotics, they are always looking for their next fix.
Suspicious, they do not easily trust others. They whisper when talking, so others don't hear.
Easily angered when they see other people getting hurt, protective of those close to them.
Energetic, constantly tapping their feet or fingers. They often can't wait to do something new.
A young and childish soul that has a sense of wonder for anything. They have a little skip in their step.
A weak and diseased individual, they cough after almost every sentence they speak.
Wise beyond their years, they often give advice to others. They speak with a lot of confidence.
Demanding, they require others to do as they are told, they do not take no for an answer.
Charitable, they often share their food and drink with others. Always willing to help out a friend.
Jealous, they wish to get higher up in the world to show off to others.
Observing and quiet, they wait until someone approaches them. They know quite a lot about others.
A bumbling idiot, they say anything that crosses their mind. They speak before they (try to) think.
Shy and apologetic, apologizes and excuses themselves every other sentence.
Kind and welcoming; would make an excellent innkeep if it weren't for their greed.
Ignorant towards the value of currency, finds happiness in simple things.
Thinks everyone is better than them, very insecure.
Does not care what others think of them, dresses and speaks accordingly.
Very bright and intelligent but talents wasted through substance abuse.
Very flirty but almost never engages in any romantic affairs.
An old soul, they are convinced they are very wise but not everyone would agree.
Makes decisions based on the people around him, easily persuaded, could not live without spouse.
Has been hunting a specific creature for years and is thoroughly obsessed with it.
Knows the adventurers by name and has heard of their deeds but is not impressed.
Fidgets with their fingers a lot, can not stay still for even a second.
A very warm parental figure, they are an important part of the community they live in.
A calm individual, not easily jolted or angered. They are hard to intimidate.
Has no patience, they still have a lot to do today and their time will not be wasted.
Angered easily by foolish or childish behavior, does not appreciate jokes.
Completely in love with another individual, will not accept a bad remark about that person.
Uncharismatic but loved by many, his demeanor is extremely kind but very awkward.
Jokes constantly about the stupidity of others but often trips over their own feet.
Scared to death of Dragonborn, they have had a traumatic experience with a dragon.
Very vain and focused on looks, runs hands through their hair/beard often.
Has bad eyesight, does not respond to any visually alarming things.
Claims they come from royalty and act as such, however, nobody knows their heritage.
A liar and a cheat, will do anything for a gold coin, does not like to spend money.
A hulking individual for their race, they are strong but very stupid.
They are very mean to people that are not their gender.
Almost always happy, prefers to skip instead of walk, their pockets are stuffed with candy.
Grim and somber, they are rarely seen in bright daylight and prefer darkness.
Would love to be an adventurer, easily impressed by magical displays of any kind.
Angry with the leadership of their community, blames everything on them.
A gentle person, they feel most at home in the wild, walks barefoot.
A kind and artistic person, they have a sketchbook with them at all times.
A typical scholar, when relaying information they often refer to some book they have read.
A charismatic and pleasant person, they have many valuable connections in the community.
A classless person, they often burp or fart without apologizing.
They have big dreams about becoming renowned and famous with their trade.
A hard worker they practice and toil deep into the night, making them very tired.
Straightforward and to the point, does not care about pleasantries.
Has a bad leg, walks slow but they tough it out without complaint.
They have a dual personality, they are complete opposites in terms of likes and dislikes.
Claims they see the future in their dreams, but they claim it after events have passed.
Wears masks to hide their face, their masks show their emotional state of that day.
Is extremely proud of their kid(s), talks about them a lot.
Clumsy, they often drop things they are handed and when walking bump into other people.
Optimistic, they quite often see a silver lining to a bad situation.
Indifferent, they do not care about a lot of things that others care about.
Pessimistic, they see the worst in the best of things.
Lives by the law and some of their own rules, some of which are a bit weird.
Does not trust people they have not met yet.
Curious, they has a profound interest in the origins of one of the adventurers.
Battles narcolepsy, sometimes falls asleep or dozes off mid sentence.
Has to do some actions and say some things five times in sequence.
Has a hard time believing there is any sort of evil in the world until they see it themselves.
Friendly but quite often judges peoples' worth by their clothing and jewelry.
Forgetful, they often forget people's names, faces but also details about their surroundings.
Creepy, they often stand a little too close for comfort to others without reason.
Diva, they can and shall not live without preposterous luxuries.
Reserved, they keep their emotions in check even in great danger.
Extremely friendly to small humanoids, they have a soft spot for the small folk.
Friendly and very talented but brush off any praise they receive for what they do.
They love to take a bet, they have made a lot of money with it as well.
Easily distracted but they are fascinated and captivated by shiny objects.
Chaotic in their demeanor, they hoard one certain type of furniture in their dwelling.
A careless individual, they love walking in the rain.
Adopted by a different race as a child they have different customs than could be expected.
Extremely lazy they do not care to do any work if it is not necessary.
Very distrustful, they have wild conspiracy theories about things happening in their community.
Indecisive, they doubt themselves a lot, they often change clothing and hairstyle.
Unnervingly sweet in their demeanor, says the most horrible things with a smile.
Slightly unhinged, they can suddenly respond quite extreme or emotional without reason.

table.name: d100 Drinking Toasts
table.caption: Drinking Toasts
rows: Here's to the ditch, may it be warm and cozy when we end up there later tonight.
Here's to cheating, stealing, and drinking. May you cheat death, steal hearts, and always drink with me.
May you have warm words on a cold evening, a full moon on a dark night and the road downhill all the way to your door.
Here's to [drink], the cause of, and solution to all life's problems.
Whilst the hearth is still aglow, let the [drink] flow!
Here's to my middlefinger, for always sticking up for me when I needed it most.
To the king, the queen, or whoever rules these bloody lands.
And to those who embrace the night early, we mourn their weak wills and pray for those lonely souls
Here's to doing and drinking, not sitting and thinking.
Cheers, for the liver is evil and must be punished tonight.
If I should stumble out this bar, I hope the night is worth the scar
Here's to those who will have to clean up the mess we leave.
Here's to being single, drinking doubles, and seeing triple.
Over the teeth, over the gums, look out stomach here it comes.
Here's to [drink], not as good as (wo)men, but pretty close.
Drink until the sun comes up, drink until the sun goes down, if you drink on both occassions you will never frown.
Tonight, the only thing I worry about is turning [drink] into piss.
It matters not if the glass is half empty or half full, clearly there's room for more!
Here's to your nose, here's to your chin,here's to the hole, in-between it goes in!
One beer, two beers, three beers, four, still depressed? Drink some more.
As you slide down the banister of life, may the splinters never face the wrong way.
A toast to bread, for without bread, there would be no toast.
Time is never wasted, when you're wasted all the time.
May I alwayss be remembered for what I have done, not what I'm about to do.
I can't find the words that go well with this drink, perhaps they're at the bottom of the glass. Cheers!
I would like to thank my arms for always being by my side, my legs for always supporting me, and my fingers, because I can always count on them.
Lift em high and drain em dry, here's to the person who says "my turn to buy"!
Pain makes you stronger. Tears make you braver. Heartbreak makes you wiser. And [drink] makes you remember none of that.
To mighty fights, wilds nights, and the clink of good coin in our purses!
Let our drinks be full, our spirits hearty, and our blades sharp!
Another day another bender, no retreat no surrender.
To the confusion of our enemies!
More poison, there's things inside me that need killing!
Here's to us! May we live respected and die regretted.
To good luck and taking chances!
May the saddest day of your future, be no worse than the happiest day of your past.
To those who guide us through darkness into light.
Here's to Dame Fortune; may she smile upon you and may you never meet her daughter, Miss Fortune
Life is a waste of time, and time is a waste of life. So let's get wasted all of the time, and have the time of our life.
Life is a jest and all things show it, I thought so once and now I know it.
For every wound, a balm. For every sorrow, cheer. For every storm, a calm. For every thirst, a beer.
Here's to a long life and a happy one. A quick death and an easy one. A good love and an honest one. A cold drink and another one.
May the winds of fortune sail you, may you sail a gentle sea. May it always be the other guy, who says, "this drink's on me.
May misfortune follow you the rest of your life, but never catch up.
May sweet laughter lighten every load. May the spark of arcane magic shorten every road. And may all your friends remember all the favours you are owed!
May you have the hindsight to know where you've been, foresight to know where you're going, and insight to know when you've gone too far
May we get what we want, but never what we deserve.
I drank to your health in company. I drank to your health alone. I drank to your health so many times, I nearly ruined my own.
May we suffer as much sorrow as drops of wine we are about to leave in our glasses!
Always remember to forget the things that made you sad, never forget to remember the things that made you glad.
May we all have the chance to to prove that money does not make you happy.
May your copper turn to gold and your silvers turn to platinum.
May you live as long as you like, and have all you like as long as you live.
A rich man lives in a castle, a poor man lives by the sea. But a whiskey glass and a nice round ass are home sweet home to me.
Health to those I love, wealth to those who love me.
A round to the best, may we never get less than we deserve and more than we may ever need
May our children have wealthy parents.
May your heart be light and happy, may your smile be big and wide and may your pockets always have a coin or two inside!
Steal my gold that's all right, steal my drink you'll get a fight!
A toast to [deity] for [drink] is proof that [deity] loves us and wants us to be happy!
May neighbors respect you, trouble neglect you. Angels protect you and heaven accept you.
May you be in heaven a full half hour before the devil knows you're dead.
To [deity] may they bless these people!
May you always lie, cheat, and steal. Lie beside the one you love, cheat the devil, and steal away from bad company.
To the skies, may we fall long before they do!
Here's to hell: May the stay there be as fun as the way there.
Here's to the night's we won't remember, with the friends we'll never forget.
Here's to those who wish us well, all the rest can go to hell.
To ourselves, as no one is likely to concern themselves with our welfare.
Here's to those who wish us well, all the rest can go to hell.
I would rather be here, with the people in this room, than with the best people in the world!
To making friends in new places!
To those who've seen us at our worst and seen us at our best, and cannot tell the difference.
To family that are friends, and to friends that are family!
Here's to the friends who love us, the losers that lost us and the lucky ones yet to meet us!
Here's to you and here's to me, and if by chance we disagree, to hell with you! And here's to me!
There are good ships, there are wood ships, and ships that sail the sea. But the best ships, are friendships, And may they always be.
Let us raise our drinks in honor of those who came before, and those who are soon to come. To good health, my friends, and a good night to you all.
May the roof above these friends never fall in, and may the friends beneath this roof never fall out.
I don't care what those others say, you people are all right!
Friends may come and friends may go, but [drink] is here to soothe the blow.
If I die before you, raise a glass in my name. If you go before me I'll do the same
Cheers, to whomever loves us even though we may not deserve it.
Here's to roses and lilies in bloom, you in my arms, and me in your room. A door that is locked, a key that is lost and a night that is 50 years long.
Cheers to beers and legs behind your ears.
To not knowing left from right and hoping I'm not left and end up all right!
A drink, to whoever your heart beats for.
May we kiss who we please, and please who we kiss
Here is to the girl on the hill, that says she won't but her sister will. (boy/his brother, person, their sibling)
May all your ups and downs be under the covers!
To sweet love, a long life and a lousy liver!
With this glass, rich, and deep, we cradle our sorrows to sleep.
To the fallen, may they guide our hearts and our blades!
Here's to getting out alive where others did not.
I raise a glass to the fallen, for I am thankful to drink with those that remain standing.
Tonight we'll drown our sorrow untill we remember them on the morrow.

table.name: d100 Voice Acting References
table.caption: Voices
rows: Speaks fast with a small lisp
Relaxed with a lot of contented humming
Puts emphasis on the wrong part of words
Loud with a lot of bravado
Notes of animalistic growling and snarling
Inhaling and exhaling with a thin wheeze
Speaks in the back of the mouth
Speaks like royalty, uses complex vocabulary
Vocalizes in the front of the mouth
Tuts and clicks tongue a lot
Adds syllables to words to emphasize
Speaks like their tongue is numb
Speaks with their lower jaw jutted out
Keeps vowels as short as possible
Low rumbling, the words strung together
Speaks in third person about themselves
Switches between two types of voices
Mumbles notes to self in between sentences
Draws out most vowels when speaking
Speaks as if they have a cold/blocked nose
Often spits out words with contempt
Uses the words/sounds "uh" and "uhm" a lot

table.name: d100 Slightly Magical Trinkets
table.caption: Magical Trinkets
rows: A wooden statuette of a cat that purrs softly when you pet it.
A four leaf clover preserved in a large amber that glows soflty in the dark.
A charred {@item flute|phb} which emits smoke when played.
Bootlaces that tie themselves when commanded to do so.
A coin that changes to either gold or silver depending on which face it lands on when flipped.
A pan which does not require grease to cook in and magically seasons the food to perfection.
A piece of cloth that can clean the rust off of any metal with one wipe.
A music box which can record 1 minute of music played by an instrument.
An intricately-carved {@creature troglodyte} skull that hums a sad tune.
A soft leather {@item pouch|phb} with fancy gold numbers that show how many gold pieces are inside of it.
A playing card that changes its face whenever it is tapped in a specific way.
An ice cube that never melts.
A {@item shortsword|phb} that softly sobs and whines whenever it is touched.
A quill that writes down all the words it is dictated.
A book that changes its contents to a different children's story every week.
A painting showing a nature scene. Birds fly across the scene in the painting every now and then.
A bag which sighs as if annoyed whenever you put an item in it.
A key that will only open the lock it can unlock when asked kindly.
A canvas {@item two-person tent|phb|tent} that takes on the color of its surroundings when pitched.
A crystal goblet that bounces instead of shattering whenever it is dropped.
A {@item bedroll|phb} which can be folded to fit inside your pocket.
A {@item hooded lantern|phb|lantern} that ignites by itself whenever the sun goes down.
A seashell which, when left undisturbed, moves 1 inch toward the nearest ocean or sea each day.
A pair of glasses without temples that hover in the air just in front of the face.
A comb which changes the hair it combs to a random color.
A needle which magically mends rips and tears in clothing and fabrics as per the {@spell mending} cantrip.
A purple rose that never wilts.
A drinking glass that can only be filled up to half full. {@italic (Or half empty depending on your views)}.
A bag of blue marbles. Each of them hums in a soft harmonious tone when rolled.
A compass that always points to the closest rabbit.
A {@item torch|phb} that is always wet and dripping. It only ignites when submerged in salt water.
A six-sided die that announces the number it rolled in a soft spoken lady's voice.
A harp that sounds like a flute when played.
A glass {@item orb|phb} with swirling mists inside.
A spinning top which sparks with harmless electricity when spun.
A {@item shortbow|phb} which says "miss" in a monotone gnomish voice whenever you miss your target.
A glass birdcage that amplifies or silences the song of any birds within.
A coin {@item pouch|phb} that always sounds and feels as if it is full of coins as long as there is at least one coin inside.
A snowglobe that causes snow to fall for a few seconds in a 5-foot radius when you shake it.
A dark blue eraser which is able to erase non-magical ink from paper.
An envelope that can only be opened without magical means by the person it is adressed to.
A cloak that always seems to billow dramatically as if caught in the wind.
A pair of glasses that allow the wearer to read a random language. The language changes each day.
A quill that never runs out of ink.
A gold ring that turns to silver when on the finger of a creature that is cursed.
Parchment that burns to ashes after anything written on it is read by anyone other than the writer.
A {@item hammer|phb} that makes no noise when used to forge metal.
A cooking pot that stirs itself when commanded to do so.
A cheese knife that turns into a living mouse for 1 hour when it comes into contact with cheese.
A metal plate that heats up any regular-sized pot or kettle that is placed on top of it.
A stone that laughs whenever someone makes a joke nobody laughed at.
A {@item candle|phb} that has a green flame when lit.
A stone tablet which predicts weather conditions for the next 3 days through glowing runes.
A {@item riding saddle|phb} that summons a magical ladder to allow a small humanoid to easily mount the creature it is on.
Fancy boots that magically change color to fit the color scheme of the rest of the outfit.
Curtains that open and close when commanded to do so.
A key that crumbles to dust after it unlocks the lock it belongs to.
A 1 inch, solid silver cube that removes non-magical tattoos when rubbed on the tattooed skin.
A stuffed bear that tells bedtime stories to the creature holding it.
A hat that flies and settles on a random head within 30 feet when thrown.
A platinum disc that emits a shrill tone whenever it senses smoke.
A linen bag that washes and dries all the clothes put in it over the course of an hour.
A scarf that changes the voice of the creature wearing it.
A mug that chills any type of ale that is poured into it to the perfect temperature.
A small stone owl that turns its head toward a creature when they cast a spell.
A pirate's flag that can magically display the colors of a faraway nation instead.
A dark red book that keeps a tally count all the creatures the owner has killed.
A navy blue wooden box. Once per day when it is opened, a butterfly flies out of it.
An enchanted brick which is under the effects of {@spell feather fall} only when nothing is touching it.
A towel that clears acne and removes small scars when rubbed on the skin.
A small terracotta pot which fills up with a new mix of herbs and spices every day.
A bit and bridle that temporarily changes the color of the horse to pure white.
A small brass bell that rings every morning one hour past sunrise. The sound is loud enough to wake a creature.
A feather duster which dusts objects by itself when commanded to do so.
A glass ornament that changes its shape into a different fruit every day.
A lace fan that, when unfolded, floats in mid-air and softly fans.
A silver bracelet in the shape of a snake that slowly curls and moves around the arm.
A board that hovers 2 inches above the ground and supports the weight of a medium-sized creature.
A cast iron pan that floats on water.
A holy symbol which recites the beliefs or tenets of the deity it belongs to on command.
An hourglass in which the sand flows upwards.
An ocarina made of bone that when played sounds as if a quartet of ocarinas is being played.
Porcelain plates that clean and stack themselves after being used.
A spherical crystal that displays a swirling galaxy inside.
A fishing hook that always smells of fish. When submerged in water it secretes a few drops of blood.
An eyeball in a bottle. The color of the iris changes depending on which plane of existence it is on.
A quill that can write smokey markings in mid-air. The markings disappear after 1 hour or if blown away.
A leather-bound book in which all illustrations made inside it become slightly animated.
A purple vial with a glass stopper that when opened a wisp of lavender incense smoke comes out.
A small golden fork that turns into a spoon when tapped against any surface.
A silver knight chess piece that whinnies softly when stroked.
Gloves made of white silk that become black for 1 hour if they come into direct contact with poison.
A clay spinning top in the shape of a dancing woman that soflty sings a sad song when spun.
A small glass terrarium that magically grows few tiny strawberries every day.
A square glass vial that when filled with salt water turns the water to salt over the course of a day.
A solid gold lockpick that whispers "jackpot" when it successfully opens a lock.
A fishing rod that can magically turn into a walking cane.
A small square painting that turns into a mirror when any creature comes within 1 foot of it.
Fancy clothes that neatly fold themselves when taken off and left undisturbed for 1 minute.
An arcane powered watch which displays the time, date (if any) and the plane of existence it is on.

table.name: d100 Pirate Names
table.caption: Pirates
rows: Anesh Daquare, Scourge of the Seas
Jenny Tulls, Courtesan of the Waves
Lady Grace, the Storm of the North
The Sunburnt Priest of the Oceans
Ukagawa, the Dragon of the South
Vic of Altenport, King of the Tides
Zirana the Witch of the Seas

table.name: d100 Market Stalls
table.caption: Market Stalls
rows: A female dwarf butcher selling meat of a dragon hatchling. Upon closer inspection it is revealed to be the carcass of a kobold.
A gnome woman selling pet Mimics shaped like small household items. One of the cages is open.
A half-elf man selling hand carved dice, sometimes he plays a few (unfair) games for coin with curious shoppers.
Two halfling brothers selling vegetables; your eye is drawn to peculiar roots seemingly from a far-off country.
An old human lady pushing a cart filled with porcelain cats painted in different motifs. She claims they protect people from evil.
A gnome man running a stall selling precious gemstones, both polished and unpolished. 2 heavily-armored dwarves guard the stall.
An elf woman selling scented oils which calm the nerves and make you sleep better.
A tiefling woman selling silks and cloths of all colors. She gives (unwanted) fashion advice to whomever walks by.
A recruitment stall for an adventuring guild: two humans are handing out pamphlets while a dwarf shouts the perks of joining.
A dragonborn man selling enchanted torches that give off light with adjustable brightness in various colors.
An old gnome woman selling herbs and tinctures for healing and cooking purposes. The sign also says "poison" in thieves' cant.
A young elf man selling flowers, small plants and saplings of trees. A lot of young women swarm around him.
A tiefling man and human man selling high-quality paper and blank books.
A halfling woman selling make-up currently in the process of demonstrating her products on a startled passerby.
A half-orc man selling coal from the local mines. He claims it comes from the deepest mineshaft and thus burns hotter than any other.
A family of halflings selling fresh strawberries (a delicacy known well among the locals).
A tiefling behind a stall that is completely empty except for a red velvet pillow. On top of the pillow rests a jet black stone.
A stall run by a red dragonborn man and a halfling woman selling home-baked cookies and cakes.
A small family of humans running a vegetable stall. They sell non-seasonal vegetables, grown from their greenhouse.
An elf woman selling spices from the East. A favorite among locals is "Dragon's Claw," which makes for a great addition to dark meats.
A half-elf man selling wooden canes carved to resemble animals. The man has a pet snake coiled around his arm.
A gnome man pulling a small display cart laden with portrait drawings, 2 stools and an easel.
A blonde elf woman selling glass snowglobes. In them are displayed carved models of monuments within the city.
A dark-skinned dwarf man selling unrefined iron, tin and copper.
A tall gnome man runs a stall selling nautical instruments and wayfinding equipment.
A blue-skinned tiefling woman in gypsy-styled garments sits behind a table, reading hands and cards.
A stall with an old human man selling roasted nuts.
A family of humans selling dairy products from their farm. The smell of the cheeses is sharp and fills the air.
A human and two dragonborn men selling freshly-caught fish.
A half-orc hunter selling parts of deer he shot the day before. It is busy at the stall and the meat is being sold at auction.
A gnome woman selling wooden and metal spinning tops from a small cart.
A half-elf woman selling inks and quills. She has feathers woven in her hair and ink stained hands.
Three young children with a rickety cart polishing shoes. Upon inspection you see a 4th child attempting to steal from the customers.
A pair of gnomes selling blue carrots. They claim that if stewed and eaten, the carrots will make you see better for a limited time.
A dwarf man dressed in a comically over-the-top miner's outfit selling realistic looking candy rocks and gemstones.
A human man selling crates and boxes of dark oak wood. Supposedly the wood is resistant to fire and flames.
A family of halflings runs a large stall filled with breads. They also make fresh sandwiches from ingredients available elsewhere in the market.
A middle-aged human man pushing a cart filled with cabbages. They are severely overpriced but he seems to be turning a profit.
An elf woman selling bottled spring water. It is not artificially cooled but it is icy cold to the touch.
Two dragonborn women selling brightly-colored kites in different shapes and sizes. A dragon-shaped kite flies above the stall, whether there is wind or not.
A tan human woman selling gloves made of exotic leathers, currently expertly cutting some grey leather with a thin sharp knife.
An elf woman selling 3 types of seasonal wine she taps from barrels into bottles.
A dwarf woman next to a small cart with a massage table. As you walk past she swiftly corrects the neck of a human man.
An extravagant human woman selling hats and scarves. As you walk by, you can smell her strong, flowery perfume.
A gnome man selling a few large, freshly caught swordfish he claimed he caught using a live chicken as bait.
A dragonborn woman selling beeswax prayer candles for various deities.
A human woman selling caged birds. Next to carrier pigeons and ravens she sells brightly colored parakeets and canaries.
A half-orc woman with a large straw-bedded pen filled with young, healthy-looking calves and a few older cows.
A halfling family selling jams and jellies made from local fruits.
Two half-elf brothers selling different flavors of tea. The younger brother sells a special hallucinogenic tea secretly on the side.
A human woman selling sewing equipment. Her most expensive items are adamantine sowing needles and special spidersilk thread.
A red-skinned tiefling man selling fireworks; anything from sparklers and flares to rockets.
A firbolg man with long curly hair selling soap and hair products. The smell of citrus and mint fills the air around the stall.
A pretty well-dressed kobold boy trying to sell polished rocks stalled out on an upside-down crate.
Two young gnome women selling handcrafted dresses and skirts in gnome and halfling sizes.
A rough-looking male dwarf adventurer selling scavenged animal parts, armor and weapons.
A tiefling woman selling vegetable curries made on the spot. She serves them in large hollowed-out coconut bowls.
A gnome man with a small cart filled with music boxes. As you try them, one of them plays the anthem of a rebel organization.
Three human brothers selling apples and apple cider from their family-owned orchard.
A young firbolg woman selling handmade jewelry made mainly from wood and semiprecious gemstones.
A pair of halflings selling potatoes and yams.
A gnome man selling truffles from a cart pulled by his pet pig.
A group of 3 humans selling clams and crawfish. One of them is a sorcerer, on a sale he freezes the produce in a thin layer of ice.
A scruffy goblin woman selling bundled packets of vegetable peels, bones and meat scraps to make soup from.
A dragonborn woman selling sweet candy made from a poisonous cactus. The candy itself is harmless but sales seem slow.
A human man trying to pass off pink bananas as magical fruits. Upon inspection, they are revealed to be regular bananas painted pink.
A male half-orc tailor selling cloth shirts and offering repairs for any type of clothing. His large hands work with astounding precision.
A male human sorcerer at a small stall offering to remove a single memory for gold. The price of the service depends on the memory.
A group of humans and halflings selling fruits and vegetables from their homestead.
A halfling pulling a cart with an oven on it selling smoked salmon. The thin wisp of smoke coming from the oven smells delicious.
A human man and woman selling poultry and eggs.
A halfling woman selling fabrics on rolls used for furniture and drapes.
A gnome man selling pipes and different flavors of tobacco from a small stall.
A family of dwarves selling craftsmen tools and iron nails. They also offer simple repairs for most items on the side.
A human man pulling a small cart with books from his faith. He also sells reading glasses.
A dwarf man wearing a keg on his back from which he taps a potent energizing alcoholic beverage into small shot glasses.
A gnome woman selling various shapes and sizes of glass vials and a few (healing) potions.
A half-elf man selling city maps from a stand. He offers advice on the best taverns and on which places to avoid.
An elf woman selling different types of finely-crafted arrows. She has a keen eye for people who try to steal from her.
An old dragonborn woman selling white tablecloths and doilies.
A human man selling honey he harvested from his own beehives.
A sun-tanned dwarf man selling coconuts and other tropical fruits.
A halfling family selling different types of wheat and flour.
A small group of goliaths selling wooden planks and lumber.
An old gnome man selling various books from an overladen stall.
A young human girl and a young tiefling boy selling lemonade from a makeshift stand.
An elf woman and halfling man selling homemade perfumes. They have various flower, fruity and wood scents on display.
A family of gnomes selling different types of farm animal meats. They also sell hot sausages with a spiced tomato-based sauce.
A young firbolg woman selling seeds for various vegetables and flowers.
A human man selling various tanned leathers and hides from common farm animals.
A dwarf man selling woolen socks with various patterns. He claims it is impossible to lose one sock from the pair.
A couple of halflings selling olives and olive oil. Their specialty is a serving of garlic olives which most customers eat at the stall.
A goliath woman selling carved stone statues and keepsakes of various deities and their symbols.
An old elf man selling a couple of wands and staffs inlaid with crushed precious and semiprecious gemstones.
A dwarf woman selling knives and daggers she forged herself. She also sharpens dull blades for a small fee.
A gnome man with a large reclining chair on wheels offering dentist services. The patients seem to leave in quite some pain.
A half-orc woman selling hunting traps for various types of prey.
A closed red tent with a sign that reads "Auntie Tina's." Upon entering you meet a female gnome offering advice for relationship trouble.
A human boy and a goblin man selling bags of stinky mulch and fertilizer for gardens.
A half-orc man selling mining and lumbering equipment. The pickaxes and axes are made of a dark-tinted steel.

table.name: d100 More Market Stalls
table.caption: Market Stalls
rows: An old elf woman selling hand carved flutes and ocarinas. They have fine elven scrolling engraved in them.
Two half-orcs men selling firewood and charcoal.
A human man wearing a thick layered robe selling woolen cloaks and coats.
A gnome woman selling straw idols and bundles that supposedly protect and guard your home against spirits.
Two old halfling men selling freshly made potato salad, served with chives and bread.
A dragonborn woman selling hot sauce she made using a recipe from her great great grandmother.
A tiefling man selling velvet pillows and finely woven rugs. The style of the items seems outlandish and imported.
A dwarf man selling empty kegs, one of them draws your attention as it has dwarven runes engraved on it.
A human woman selling bundles of herbs and flowers to make your home smell fresh.
A human man wearing a hooded robe and featureless mask selling leeches in jars.
A dwarf woman selling dust grounded from various metals, rocks and precious stone. A female human with a scimitar stands guard.
A gnome woman selling live butterflies in large glass jars with plants in them.
A goliath man selling coils of thick hemp rope. He is currently in the process of knotting strands together into a new rope.
A human woman selling leather goods for horseriders. Saddles, satchels and other equipment fill the table.
An elf selling small paintings of trees in various seasons, they are currently sitting silently painting a tree in winter.
A dwarf man and half-orc man selling livestock. They still have a few pigs in a pen and chickens in wooden cages.
Two gnome boys offering a message delivering service, one stays at the cart and writes the messages, the other runs through the city.
A goblin man selling a weird combination of adventuring items, some have blood on them or are damaged.
A dragonborn man selling metal and glass goblets of various sizes and designs.
An old human man selling homemade mustard from a small stall.
A pair of gnomes selling large fresh cabbages and jars of pickled cabbage.
A tiefling woman selling dried fruits. Some of the fruits appear to be have been imported or out of season.
A family of gnomes led by one old gnome woman selling hard candies. Sold in paper bags, the smell is extremely sweet.
A pair of humans selling freshly baked pancakes with various seasonal and regional toppings.
A teenage human girl selling beautiful flowers made from brightly colored paper and fabric from a cart.
A bald-headed dwarf man with a neatly styled beard selling shaving cremes and beard styling products.
A couple of dwarves selling pears and a sweet tasting spirit brewed from pears.
A tiefling woman and halfling woman selling large bags of rice.
A human woman selling small hand painted ornamental tiles. Most have floral designs but some depict creatures and humanoids.
A gnome man and dwarf man selling terracotta pottery and vases.
A dwarf man selling jeweled rings and pins to be used in braided hair or beards.
A goliath man selling black kegs of pure glacial water.
A dwarf woman selling small kegs, cans and jars of lamp oil and pitch.
A gnome man and old human man selling teddy bears and dolls.
A young gnome girl sitting on a blanket selling small crowns and bracelets made from tiny flowers she tied together.
A kobold selling chewing tobacco and carved wooden spit jars from a cart.
A dwarf woman selling good luck charms, anything from rabbit feet to blessed silver charms.
Two human men selling live crabs and lobsters.
A half-elf woman selling leather boots, gloves, bracelets and bracers adorned with tiny silver studs.
A goliath woman selling drinking horns in various sizes, the largest has big brass bands around it.
Two gnome men selling sets of silverware, cooking knives and letter openers.
A human man selling freshly baked potatoes, served with a creamy mustard sauce and chives.
A dwarf woman selling bags of feathers and down commonly used for quality pillows and bedding.
A family of halflings selling rugs and tapestries. The more expensive ones have intricate patterns and nature scenes depicted on them.
A human man selling all sorts of containers. Chests, crates, bags, jars and barrels are stacked and placed in one another.
A half-orc woman selling powdered bone and vials of blood of various animals and creatures.
A dwarf man selling salt. He is currently splitting a salt block with a large mallet and chisel.
A small family of halflings selling goats' cheese and milk.
A couple of goliaths selling gardening equipment and pots.
A family of dwarves selling metal hinges, locks and doorhandles.
An old gnome woman selling hundreds of buttons all sorted by color and shape in many boxes.
A human man selling unpolished mountain crystals of various sizes and colors.
A halfling man selling fishing poles, lures, hooks and other equipment.
A goliath man selling fire starting kits, sleeping bags and tents.
Two tieflings selling freshly baked pastries filled with meats and fish.
An elf woman selling food for pets and small farm animals.
A human man selling pickled vegetables in jars and dried meats.
A dragonborn woman selling nailpolish in many shades of color. Her own nails are sparkling gold.
A half-orc man selling hides and furs of various animals and creatures.
A human woman selling balls of yarn and knitted mittens and scarves.
A human woman selling handwritten and illustrated recipes for various delicious dishes of local and foreign cuisine.
A human man selling dog collars and bones.
A young gnome man selling various measuring instruments for crafting and construction.
A human man selling brushes, paints, pigments, chalks and pencils of all the colors of the rainbow.
A young human boy selling necklaces and bracelets made from seashells.
A human man selling jars of a dark paste made from hazelnuts and cocao.
A gnome woman selling lemons, limes and oranges.
A human woman and elf woman selling undergarments and pajamas.
A dwarf woman selling bristles, brooms and cleaning cloths.
A tiefling woman selling scented candles and oils.
A family of humans selling baked pastries and cakes filled with cream and fruits.
A halfling man selling candlesticks and metal candle holders.
Three dragonborn men selling meats of various creatures which you can't immediately define.
A goblin woman and elf woman selling women's handbags and satchels.
A dwarf man selling small metal bells and chimes. The instruments make crystal clear sounds as they are moved by the wind.
An elf woman selling spice mixes for stews and mulled wine.
A firbolg woman selling small packets of fragrant dried flowers and herbs.
A dwarf man selling barbed steel arrow tips, caltrops and crossbow bolts.
A human man selling scroll cases, leather book covers and messenger bags.
A halfling woman selling fabrics on rolls used for furniture and drapes.
A gnome man selling pipes and different flavors of tobacco from a small stall.
A family of dwarves selling craftsmen tools and iron nails. They also offer simple repairs for most items on the side.
A human man pulling a small cart with books from his faith, he also sells reading glasses.
A dwarf man wearing a keg on his back from which he taps a potent energizing alcoholic beverage into small shot glasses.
An elf woman selling spice mixes for stews and mulled wine.
A firbolg woman selling small packets of fragrant dried flowers and herbs.
A dwarf man selling barbed steel arrow tips, caltrops and crossbow bolts.
A human man selling scroll cases, leather book covers and messenger bags.
A halfling man selling tomatoes, cucumbers and zucchinis.
A human man selling large wooden cutting boards, spoons and kitchen utensils.
A couple of halflings selling bags of wool.
Two human men selling canvas bags filled with dark brown coffee beans.
A dragonborn man selling silk shirts, skirts and pants.
A gnome man selling heart shaped cookies with bright red icing and red roses from a small cart.
A dwarf man selling hand carved chess sets and chessboards, one of the sets has a missing king.
A goliath woman selling rolls of felt and canvas dyed in dull colors.
A dragonborn selling canvas lined crates of mineral rich volcanic soil.
A tiefling man selling enchanted bracelets. The bracelets shed a very dim light when in darkness.
A halfling man selling bleached skulls and bones of various creatures.
A family of gnomes selling shrimps, they also sell a skewer with grilled shrimp.

table.name: d100 Ship Names
table.caption: Ships
rows: Her Holiness the Queen of the Blue
The King of the Glittering Waves
The Traveler's Home upon the Waves

table.name: d100 Sculptures
table.caption: Sculptures
rows: A smiling gnome woman shaking hands with a winking kobold.
A knight in full plate armor holding a smooth golden orb high above their head.
A mountain goat on top of a large stone pedestal.
A human seated on an ornate throne, a dagger pierces the back of the throne.
A half-orc pirate with a peg leg leaning against a cannon.
A life size blossoming cherry tree, every flower is engraved with names.
An open archway adorned with woodland creatures.
An elf woman with an anguished expression on her face and broken crown on her head.
A 10-foot cube of stone polished so smoothly one can see their own reflection in it.
A large eagle with out-stretched wings, perched on a 20-foot column.
Two tieflings dancing in loose, swirling garments.
A crying mermaid holding a compass in her open hand.
A silver dragon with folded wings and eyes closed as if sleeping.
The bust of a handsome dwarf man,his long braided beard is draped around the pedestal.
A masked figure in a jovial stance, the mask changes every day.
A life size skull on a dark granite pedestal. Polished to a sheen by people touching it.
A carved relief showing a battle between devils and angels in great detail.
A large robed and hooded figure holding a baby in their arms.
A slightly outdated scale model of the city, names of locations are engraved in it.
A group of five humanoids of various races holding a burning brazier above their heads.
A beautiful human woman holding an open book in one hand and a quill in the other.
A snake coiled tightly around a bushel of wheat.
A dwarf woman in armor raising a tankard.
A halfling with a lute sitting on the shoulders of a goliath.
A bust of a stern looking dragonborn. The plaque on the pedestal has been removed.
A larger-than-life lion with thick bands engraved with runes around its ankles.
An imp clutching a large treasure chest with their arms and legs.
A relief of a forest scene, the center features a stag with extremely large and intricate antlers.
A woman holding two swords by her sides; rain has smoothed all details of the sculpture.
A young gnome man astride an armored dog, holding a longsword in the air.
A pegasus on a 15-foot high marble pedestal.
A distraught human man clutching their chest with one hand and reaching out with the other.
A relief of a storm scene, featuring a blue dragon in flight with two humanoid figures in its claws.
A life-size sleeping sphinx that seemingly attracts stray cats to it.
Three farmers, each holding a different tool to work the land with.
A winged person in a combat stance holding a glaive in their hands.
A woman sitting on a throne, nursing a baby.
A rearing griffon clad in armor with upturned wings.
A kneeling person carrying the world on their shoulders.
A gnomish kid kissing another gnomish kid on the cheek.
A wolf sitting on its haunches holding a broken sword in their mouth.
A scholar in a toga holding a scroll in one hand and a cane in the other.
An extremely muscular woman straining to keep a column from toppling over.
A young human man in a loincloth with a young deer next to him.
A faceless person with a hole where their heart would be.
A whimsical pixie excitedly riding a large seahorse.
An owl perched on top of a stack of books.
A male elf with arrows shot in their back protectively holding a dove.
A goblin with a fish in their arms which is larger than themselves.
A proud looking minotaur holding a double-edged axe in their hands.
A bust of the current leader of the city on a 10-foot-high marble pedestal.
A seated crying woman holding the body of a lifeless man in her arms.
A centaur with a small bird perched on their finger, held in front of their face.
A woodcutter's axe stuck in a tree stump. A squirrel sits on the handle of the axe.
The bust of a world-famous gnomish bard who was born nearby.
An elf woman in a flowing dress with a gilded snake curled around her arm.
A rearing unicorn with a twisting horn. When it rains, the horn seems to sparkle.
A giant lizard curled around a 15-foot column adorned with vines and leaves.
A half-orc woman in armor holding a large bouquet of roses in her arms.
A small halfling woman with a sword and shield fighting an imposing chimera.
A skeletal figure with a jaunty hat playing a lute.
A faceless angelical figure holding balanced scales.
An eagle perched on a shield with a guild's crest embossed on it.
A handsome bare-chested dwarf with long hair riding a hippogriff.
A screaming harpy on a 6-foot-tall stone pedestal.
A chunky earth elemental daintily picking a flower at its feet.
A relief showing a schematic of all the planes of existence.
A stag with various types of birds perched in its antlers.
A dwarf miner with a huge grin on his face holding a rough piece of crystal aloft.
A shapely woman's form draped in a full body shroud.
A halfling girl playing a violin with five bunnies at her feet looking up at her.
A polished golem holding a large warhammer.
A robed figure with a lightning bolt-shaped wand. According to local legend, it often gets struck by lightning in storms.
A dog that once saved three children from a burning orphanage.
A robed and hooded skeleton with angelic wings holding a longsword.
An immensely large toad that croaks loudly when wet.
A sword, shield and plate helmet on a 5-foot-high granite pedestal.
Three scholars reading from a book held by the center figure.
An elvish woman carefully pouring liquid from one flask into another.
An extremely detailed torso of a muscular humanoid figure.
Four snakes coiled around each other in a helix holding the sun on their heads.
A smirking dwarf woman playing chess with a stern-looking dragonborn man.
A goliath woman sitting on a stack of books reading a thick tome.
An incredibly detailed and slightly terrifying horse-sized duck.
An octopus holding a functioning lantern in each of its tentacles.
A dryad with wild hair holding an ornate spear.
An elf man in light armor riding a moose.
A relief depicting a harvest festival which is celebrated every autumn.
A smiling kobold balancing on one feet on a large ball.
A rotund pig with outstretched wings on top of a 10-foot pedestal.
Two tough-looking elves standing back to back with fire wreathing their hands.
A female ranger nocking an arrow on an ornately-carved bow. Upon closer inspection, the bow is real.
A long-haired merman holding a gilded trident.
A life-size storm giant sitting cross-legged, seemingly meditating.
A friendly-looking female halfling in a chef's hat trying hard to hold a large kettle.
A red dragon and a gold dragon locked in battle.
A bearded gnome in a pointy hat holding a staff with an orb at the tip of it.
An adventurer who grew up in the city and saved it a long time ago.
A bust that closely resembles one of the player's characters.
A statue on a 15-foot pedestal that closely resembles the physique of the Game Master.

table.name: d100 Simple Weapon Enchanements
table.caption: Simple Weapon Enchantments
rows: Deals an additional 1 cold damage on hit.
Deals an additional 1 fire damage on hit.
Deals an additional 1 radiant damage on hit.
Deals an additional 1 necrotic damage on hit.
Deals an additional 1 force damage on hit.
Deals an additional 1 lightning damage on hit.
Deals an additional 1 acid damage on hit.
Deals an additional 1 poison damage on hit.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls and Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage on a critical hit.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deals fire damage instead of the normal weapon damage.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deals cold damage instead of the normal weapon type.
Heals you for half the damage dealt on a critical hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} cold damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} fire damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} force damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} lightning damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} acid damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} poison damage on hit.
Grants advantage on saving throws versus being {@condition frightened}.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls and an additional 20 feet to its short and long range {@i (ranged weapon only)}.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls and advantage on Strength saving throws while standing on dirt, sand, or rock.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls, and your movement speed is not reduced while swimming.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls and advantage on Dexterity saving throws while in direct sunlight or within 10 feet of open flame.
Grants a +1 bonus to attack rolls, and deals an additional 1 force damage on hit.
A creature reduced to 0 hit points from damage by this weapon falls {@condition unconscious} instead of dying.
When making more than one attack against the same creature on your turn, you have avantage on the second (and onward) attack.
Deals an additional 2 force damage on hit, and grants a +1 to Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks.
Deals an additional 1 radiant damage on hit. As a bonus action, you can cast {@spell light} targeting the sword.
Grants a +2 bonus to your Strength score.
Grants a +2 bonus to your Constitution score.
Grants a +2 bonus to your Dexterity Score.
Grants a +2 bonus to your Wisdom Score.
Grants a +2 bonus to your Intelligence Score.
Grants a +2 bonus to your Charisma Score.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} force damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} acid damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on hit.
Heals you for {@dice 1d6 + 2} on a critical hit.
On critical hit, the target has disadvantage on its next attack roll.
On critical hit, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.
Grants a +1 on attack rolls and a +2 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks.
If you are reduced to 0 hit points while wielding this weapon, you are healed for 1 hit point at the start of your next turn. This effect may only occur once per long rest.
This weapon is two weapons magically fused together. As a bonus action you can switch which weapon is active.
As an action, you can cast {@spell invisibility} once per day, targeting the weapon itself.
Grants a +1 bonus to Strength saving throws.
Grants a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws.
Grants a +1 bonus to Constitution saving throws.
Grants a +1 bonus to Wisdom saving throws.
Grants a +1 bonus to Intelligence saving throws.
Grants a +1 bonus to Charisma saving throws.
On a critical hit, all allies who can see both you and the target gain a {@dice d4} inspiration die (per {@classFeature bardic inspiration|bard||1||bardic inspiration}).
On a critical hit, reduces the target's AC by 1 if they are wearing a shield.
You may use a bonus action to halve the movement speed of one creature you have struck with this weapon this turn for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} force damage to fey creatures.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage to undead creatures.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to monstrosities and beasts.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage to celestials.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage to fiends.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to dragons.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to humanoids.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to aberrations.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to constructs.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to Giants.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to elementals.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} force damage to oozes.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to plants.
May be used as an {@item arcane focus|phb|arcane spell focus}.
May be used as a {@item druidic focus|phb|druidic spell focus}.
May be used as a holy symbol for that deity.
Twice per long rest, you may gain a {@dice 1d6} bonus to an attack roll with this weapon.
As a bonus action, you may split this weapon into two identical copies. You may also use a bonus action to merge the copies together again.
On hit, you may use a bonus action to magically teleport to a space adjacent to the target. This does not return the weapon to your hand. {@i (thrown weapon only)}
Whenever this weapon gets damaged, it automatically casts {@spell mending} on itself.
Grants a +1 bonus to your spell attack modifier.
Grants a +1 bonus to your spell save DC.
Grants a +2 bonus to an attack roll after you have moved in a straight line of 15 feet or more.
Grants a +2 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks and attack rolls when attacking while unseen.
You may use a bonus action to transform this weapon into a gauntlet, or transform it back into a weapon. The weapon appears held in your hand when transformed back.
You do not suffer disadvantage when attacking underwater with this weapon.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d6} force damage to structures and objects.
A creature reduced to 0 hit points from damage by this weapon turns to ashes.
On a critical hit, the target is shoved back 10 feet in a straight line.
Grants a +1 bonus to initiative rolls.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} to chaotic-aligned creatures on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to lawful-aligned creatures on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to good-aligned creatures on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to evil-aligned creatures on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to neutral-aligned creatures on hit(on either axis).
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} cold and {@damage 1d4} fire damage on hit.
Deals an additional {@damage 1d4} lightning and {@damage 1d4} thunder damage on hit.

entries: This stone carving is a trap shaped in honor of Zevira, a minor goddess of air and weather. According to legend, this goddess created the winds and embodied them with her voice, losing it in the process. Sometimes her voice can be heard in the howling of the winds. Others say that Zevira had her voice stolen by a storm deity. Talking in front of the trap will cause it to trigger.

entries.name: Trigger
entries: When a creature within 40 feet of the face uses their voice (including talking, using verbal spell components, etc.)

entries.name: Effect
entries: A burst of air blows outward in a 20-foot cone centered on the target. All creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed 5 feet directly away from the trap. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not pushed.

rows: Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) ({@dc 14}) or {@spell detect magic} (strong evocation)
Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) ({@dc 15}) or Intelligence ({@skill Arcana} or {@skill Religion}) ({@dc 12})

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Details
entries: A particularly intelligent creature may recognize the image of Zevira and notice the holes that enable its effects.

entries.name: Disarming
entries: Read the following text aloud when a character disarms the trap by casting {@spell dispel magic}.
As you finish casting the spell, a soft warm breeze blows around you and you hear a soft sigh from the wall. Its stony lips close and the wind ceases. You've soothed Zevira's sorrow... for now.
If the magic of the trap is dispelled this way, it regains its magic after {@dice 1d6} days.

entries.name: Other Countermeasures
entries: There are other methods of disabling the trap. Use the {@i Analysis} and {@i Solution} DCs above (if applicable) to determine whether a creature can use these methods.

entries.name: Intelligence
entries: Casting the spell {@spell silence} on the face in the wall also stops it from working for the duration. The face is also a valid target for {@spell blindness/deafness} ({@condition deafened||deafen} only) and automatically fails the saving throw.

entries.name: Strength
entries: Destroying the face (for example with a bludgeoning weapon or with {@item mason's tools|phb}) can temporarily or permanently disable it. The wall has an AC of 17 and 12 hit points.

entries.name: Wisdom
entries: Plugging the 3 holes with cloth or some other substance prevents the face from detecting sound.
An old-fashioned prank where a bucket is carefully balanced on a door. This bucket, however, is filled with acidic goo rather than harmless water.

entries.name: Trigger
entries: The bucket is balanced on a door which opens inwards. Opening the door causes it to fall, triggering the trap.

entries.name: Effect
entries: A scraping noise can be heard as the door is opened. A rusty bucket full of acidic goo tumbles down on the creature opening the door. They must succeed on a {@dc 10} dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage plus 1 bludgeoning damage, taking half of the acid damage and no bludgeoning damage on a success.

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Details
entries: A perceptive creature may see the door is slightly ajar and spot that there's something balanced on top of it.

entries.name: Disarming
entries: Read the following text aloud when a character chooses to carefully open the door with a successful Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check.
You stand to the side of the door and open it, taking shelter behind the wall as the bucket tumbles down and splashes acid on the floor across the threshold.

entries.name: Other Countermeasures
entries: There are other methods of disabling the trap. Use the {@i Analysis} and {@i Solution} DCs above (if applicable) to determine whether a creature can use these methods.

entries.name: Intelligence
entries: Using {@spell mage hand} or {@spell unseen servant} to remove the bucket safely and place it gently on the ground conserves the contents and does not make any noise in the process.

entries.name: Dexterity
entries: A creature can attempt to swiftly open the door and catch the bucket before it falls. They must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw to catch the bucket. On a failed save, they spill the bucket over themselves and take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage.

entries.name: Wisdom
entries: Closing the door causes the bucket to lose its balance and tumble down on the other side. It makes a lot of noise as the acid splatters on the floor but the creature remains unharmed on this side of the door.

These obelisks are monuments to Hekant, a minor god of the grave. Erected as a means to keep the living from plundering the tombs they protect, they also act as wards preventing the dead from encroaching on the living world.

rows: 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage; {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition paralyzed}

entries.name: Trigger
entries: The obelisk's base is a 5-foot square and the obelisk itself extends to a height anywhere from 20 to 60 feet. The obelisk's activation space is composed of 5-foot-wide lines extending outward from each of the four faces, reaching a distance equal to the height of the obelisk. When a creature moves into any of the four spaces, the corresponding side of the obelisk activates.

entries.name: Effect
entries: When a side is triggered, all creatures in the line outward from that side must make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 15}). On a failed save, they take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and are subject to one of the conditions on the table below. The condition lasts for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effects on a success. You can either choose one of the conditions, roll randomly on the table, or assign a condition to each of the sides by direction. On a success, the creature takes half the radiant damage and is not subject to the condition.

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Details
entries: A creature will easily spot the obelisk itself as it is a rather large structure. Noticing the potential danger without having seen or experienced its effects, however, may prove more difficult.

entries.name: Disarming
entries: Read the following text aloud when a character disarms the trap by casting {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell remove curse}.
As you finish casting the spell, sharp white light blinks along the runes engraved on the obelisk's surface. As the light fades, it stands inert before you, just as impressive as before.

entries.name: Other Countermeasures
entries: There are other methods of disabling the trap. Use the {@i Analysis} and {@i Solution} DCs above (if applicable) to determine whether a creature can use these methods.

entries.name: Intelligence
entries: The magic of the obelisk is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt. Creating an obstruction won't prevent the effects from activating, but creatures behind such barriers are safe from them.

entries.name: Strength
entries: Destroying the obelisk itself (for example with a bludgeoning weapon or with {@item mason's tools|phb}) without entering one of the activation spaces can render it inoperable. The obelisk has an AC of 17 and 60 hit points. Each face has 15 hit points, and may be individually destroyed to disable that face's effect.

entries.name: Wisdom
entries: It is possible to tunnel beneath or fly over the activation spaces. The activation spaces extend only from the ground to the height of the obelisk.
A face is engraved into the face of this otherwise nondescript doorknob.

entries.name: Trigger
entries: The trap activates when a creature touches the doorknob. Wearing gloves or otherwise maintaining indirect physical contact does not stop the effects from triggering.

entries.name: Effect
entries: The doorknob announces with a boisterous voice the full true name and title (if any) of the creature who touches it. The sound may be heard clearly up to 100 feet away.

rows: Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) ({@dc 13}) or {@spell detect magic} (weak divination)

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Details
entries: A perceptive creature notice the peculiar shape of the doorknob and a slight tingling sensation in their hand as they reach to open the door.

entries.name: Disarming
entries: Read the following text aloud if a character successfully unlocks the door using thieves' tools.
With your thieves' tools you manage to open the latch between the door and the frame. With a bit of wiggling you should be able to pull the door open without touching the doorknob.

entries.name: Other Countermeasures
entries: There are other methods of disabling the trap. Use the {@i Analysis} and {@i Solution} DCs above (if applicable) to determine whether a creature can use these methods.

entries.name: Intelligence
entries: Using {@spell mage hand} or {@spell unseen servant} to open the door will not trigger the trap, as these spells do not conjure creatures with names.

entries.name: Strength
entries: A creature can always attempt to kick in the door without touching the doorknob. The AC and HP of the door and frame varies depending on what material they're made of.
This traps is crafted from the half-buried hand of a long-dead earth elemental. The five fingertips appear as large rocks protruding from the ground.

entries.name: Trigger
entries: Five large rocks stand in a 10-foot circle. When a creature is between more than two of the rocks, the trap triggers.

entries.name: Effect
entries: The hand closes, grasping the creature inside. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and are {@condition restrained}. They can use an action to attempt to escape the grasp by making a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check ({@dc 15}). On a success, they slip through the massive fingers. The hand stays clenched for 24 hours, reverting back to its original state unless disarmed.

rows: Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) ({@dc 12}) or {@spell detect magic} (moderate conjuration)
Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) ({@dc 15}) or Intelligence ({@skill Arcana} or {@skill Nature}) ({@dc 13})

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Details
entries: The rocks are easily spotted and a creature may notice how they are arranged. Only through successful investigation, however, may they discover the true nature of what lies beneath.

entries.name: Disarming
entries: Read the following text aloud when a character disarms the trap by casting {@spell dispel magic}.
You cast the spell, targeting an area slightly below the surface. As the spell completes, the rocks slowly pull themselves from the ground, crumbling to pieces.

entries.name: Other Countermeasures
entries: There are other methods of disabling the trap. Use the {@i Analysis} and {@i Solution} DCs above (if applicable) to determine whether a creature can use these methods.

entries.name: Strength
entries: Destroying the rocks themselves (for example with a bludgeoning weapon or with {@item mason's tools|phb}) breaks apart the hand, disabling the trap. Each rock has an AC of 17 and 10 hit points. Once three rocks have been destroyed, the rest of the hand crumbles.

entries.name: Wisdom
entries: Simply skirting around the trap is sufficient. It may be climbed and jumped across, or other movement may make it possible to avoid touching the ground within the fingers.

entries.name: Burrowing Hand and Vertical Placement
entries: You may decide that the rocks are completely buried beneath the ground. In this case, the {@i Detection} and {@i Analysis} DCs increase by 8. The only clue that something is amiss is the presence of loose or disturbed soil.
You can also place this trap embedded into a wall or ceiling. The trigger area becomes a 10-foot tall, 5-foot radius cylinder extending from the surface it's embedded under.

A metal box embedded into the wall is filled with a poisonous liquid which turns into a gas when exposed to air. It is closed off with a metal cover which is attached to a wire. This trap is most effective in narrow hallways and corridors.

entries.name: Trigger
entries: A tripwire leading from the vent is attached to another object or anchor. When it is disturbed, the vent swings open and the poison gas immediately fills a 10-foot radius sphere. Each round the vent is open, the sphere's radius increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 20 feet. After 1 minute, the poison stored in the trap is expended, and the cloud begins to dissipate over {@dice 1d4} minutes.

entries.name: Effect
entries: This poison irritates the skin, eyes and lungs on contact. The first time a creature enters the poison cloud and every turn they start fully within the cloud, the must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and are {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes, taking half damage on a success.

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Summary
entries: {@i A successful Analysis reduces the Solution DC by 2.}

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Details
entries: A creature may spot the vent(s) in the walls or the tripwire running across the floor. When inspecting the trap they may be see how a little bit of tension would open the vent. They may also be able to discern the harmful contents of the metal box because the metal is corroded.

entries.name: Disarming
entries: Read the following text aloud when a character successfully disarms the trap with a successful Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check.
You use a blade to carefully cut the tripwire without putting any tension on it. The rope slackens and the metal cover it is attached to in the wall stays closed.

entries.name: Other Countermeasures
entries: There are other methods of disabling the trap. Use the {@i Analysis} and {@i Solution} DCs above (if applicable) to determine whether a creature can use these methods.

entries.name: Intelligence
entries: The poison still inside the vent can be stabilized with a neutral liquid such as water. After the poison has been stabilized, the existing cloud dissipates on its own over {@dice 1d4} minutes.
It is also possible to disperse the cloud using ventilation or magical wind. It takes 1 minute of wind to fully disperse the cloud.

entries.name: Constitution
entries: Creatures immune to poison (or creatures that do not need to breathe) may safely travel through the cloud.

entries.name: Wisdom
entries: Covering the vent or closing it manually prevents more gas from being released. After the vent has been closed, the cloud dissipates on its own over {@dice 1d4} minutes. If the vent is re-opened after the cloud dissipates, the liquid harmlessly splashes to the floor.
A pressure plate embedded in the floor houses a small nozzle that spews flaming gas as soon as a creature steps on it.

entries.name: Trigger
entries: A 3-foot square metal plate sinks into the ground roughly 2 inches when a creature of Medium size or larger steps on it. As the plate lowers a reservoir of flammable liquid is compressed, expelling the gas through a nozzle that ignites it into a blaze by a small spark.

entries.name: Effect
entries: A 5-foot flame shoots up, striking the creature that triggered the trap. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage, taking half damage on a success.
When a creature steps off the plate, the flame is extinguished. As long as there is sufficient weight on the plate, the flame will continue to burn for {@dice 1d4 + 1} minutes.

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Summary
entries: {@i A successful Analysis reduces the Solution DC by 3.}

entries.name: Spotting and Disarming Details
entries: A perceptive creature may spot the pressure plate in the ground. They could also notice the ash and scorch marks around the nozzle, and perhaps a faint whiff of the gas.

entries.name: Disarming
entries: Read the following text aloud when a character successfully disarms the trap with a successful Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check.
You gently work your way around the pressure plate, wedging it in place so it can't be compressed anymore.

entries.name: Other Countermeasures
entries: There are other methods of disabling the trap. Use the {@i Analysis} and {@i Solution} DCs above (if applicable) to determine whether a creature can use these methods.

entries.name: Intelligence
entries: Making it impossible for the fuel to ignite disables the trap. For example, disabling the sparking mechanism or cutting open the reservoir can prevent the plate from activating.

entries.name: Wisdom
entries: Placing sufficient (non-flammable) weight on the pressure plate causes it to burn out in {@dice 1d4 + 1} minutes.
